instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Customer told me never was droped. Problem is sometimes randomly it crashs with kernel error and reboot. Somebody repaired Macbook air with this problem?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
i would check for any liquid damage. i repaired a macbook air last week, never dropped or had any liquid spill. but when i open the back cover. i found two test points was corroded which are on the edge next to the air vent.
these air vents are really shit, they suck up anything.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: If there is no corrosion then forget about this one. I assume you ruled out bad OSX and/or SSD.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: No corrosion. I tried with another ssd. With Maverick it works ok. Just sometimes reboot. With EL Sierra no way. Doesnot even load the OS X. Never see that before?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes it was RAM. I replaced ram and now it works ok. But now I have another problem with same board. 1 day it works ok with sound and today no sound. I tried with another speakers and no sound.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Sound is all on the IO board. Try known good IO board and flat cable.
